english: to pull; to drag; to draw; to stretch

etymology.interpretation: Combines the hand component with 立 to indicate a hand action such as pulling or dragging. 立 contributed the historical sound value, while 手 anchors the meaning in manual motion, leading to verbs of drawing or tugging.

examples.chinese: 他拉开门进来(他拉開門進來)。
examples.english: He pulled the door open and came in.

examples.chinese: 请你别拉我的衣服(請你別拉我的衣服)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ bié lā wǒ de yīfu.

examples.chinese: 他们一起把车拉出泥坑(他們一起把車拉出泥坑)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen yìqǐ bǎ chē lā chū níkēng.
examples.english: They pulled the car out of the mud pit together.
